sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the set (A × B) ∩ (B × A) and verify that it is not equal to (B × A) ∩ (A × B). Thus, prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
